files.description: Single reproducible Jupyter notebook implementing experiments A/B/C/E with SymPy derivations, NumPy/SciPy numerics, parameter sweeps, plots, and save/load hooks exporting PNG/SVG figures and CSV results.
Package initializer exposing the public API for symbolic derivations, numeric experiment runners, sweep harness, plotting, and I/O utilities.
SymPy-based analytic derivations for the three experiments with stepwise symbolic transformations and helpers to produce simplified closed-form expressions for numeric use.
NumPy/SciPy numeric implementations for the three experiments including stable evaluation, vectorization, and reference checks against symbolic expressions where applicable.
Parameter sweep harness that defines experiment configurations, executes grid/latin sweeps, aggregates outputs into tidy tabular results, and supports deterministic reproducibility via seeding.
Matplotlib plotting utilities to generate all required figures from sweep results and to export plots as PNG/SVG with consistent styling.
Save/load hooks for exporting and importing CSV results and writing figure files with standardized paths, metadata, and run identifiers.
Pytest suite validating symbolic derivations and numeric implementations for each experiment via simplification checks, randomized spot checks, and regression tolerances.
Pytest suite verifying sweep reproducibility, CSV round-trips, and figure export creation without interactive backends.
Project configuration defining Python 3.11+ package metadata, dependencies (sympy/numpy/scipy/matplotlib/pandas/pytest), and pytest settings for reproducible execution.

missionDescription: Implement the three experiments as a single reproducible Jupyter notebook (and companion Python modules) using Python 3.11+ and SymPy: include (A) analytic derivations (SymPy symbolic steps), (B) numeric implementations (NumPy/SciPy), (C) parameter sweep harness, (D) automated unit tests (pytest-compatible), and (E) plotting code. Add save/load hooks to export figures (PNG/SVG) and CSV results.
missionSuccessCriteria: Includes executable code (Python script or Jupyter notebook) with clear documentation, parameters, and example outputs. Code should be runnable and produce expected results.
Includes data visualizations or figures (PNG, SVG, or described in detail) that effectively communicate findings.
